STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 2, 2024
Kathleen Schultz
WELLSPRING LUTHERAN SERVICES KENTWOOD
1715 SUTHERLAND DR,
KENTWOOD, MI, 49508-3306
Re: License #: CB410201260
SI #: 2024C0001080SI
Dear Kathleen Schultz:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB410201260
Licensee Group Organization: Wellspring Lutheran Services
Licensee Designee: DAVID M GEHM
Chief Administrator: Kathleen Schultz
Agency Name: WELLSPRING LUTHERAN SERVICES
KENTWOOD
Agency Address: 1715 SUTHERLAND DR
KENTWOOD, MI 49508-3306
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 06/28/2024
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
1/22/2024 12:00 PM Email DCWL contact
1/22/2024 12:15 PM Onsite Inspection Unannounced Visit
1/22/2024 4:30 PM Email Special Investigation
Initiation
1/25/2024 11:00 AM Phone Interview
2/2/2024 1:00 PM Video Conference Exit meeting
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12204 Facilities
Section (3) An organization may maintain satellite offices when the
Description following conditions are met:
(a) The agency has notified the department in writing prior to
opening the satellite office and has received approval to open the
satellite office.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation The agency opened a satellite office without notifying DCWL.
Investigation DCWL staff completed on-site inspection on January 22,
2024. Upon entering the office building for an unrelated matter,
DCWL noticed an office with a Wellspring sign. DCWL staff sent
an email to Associate Director to inquire and was told the office is
being used as a satellite office for the Wellspring Kentwood
license which had not been previously reported.
Associate Director (AD) was interviewed on January 25, 2024,
via telephone. She stated there was some confusion within the
agency as to what constitutes a satellite office. AD stated they are
still working towards becoming a fully functional satellite office and
had intended on notifying DCWL once the set up was completed.
The office was initially opened to accommodate Family
Preservation and Supportive Visitation contracts. She stated there
are one or two staff who occasionally work out of the office and
there is also some parent visitation being held for Muskegon
cases. AD stated the agency was not aware DCWL needed to be
notified earlier even with limited activities and staffing.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as they opened a satellite
location in Norton Shores without obtaining prior approval from
DCWL as required.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
______1/26/2024_____________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
January 26, 2024
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
2

sir_summary.summary: Wellspring Lutheran Services opened a satellite office in Norton Shores for staff work and parent visitations without obtaining prior written approval from the Department of Child Welfare Licensing, violating state rules. The agency claimed confusion over what constituted a satellite office and intended to notify the department once setup was complete. Culpability lies with the agency for failing to understand and comply with clear regulatory requirements for notification and approval.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violation is an administrative paperwork/policy compliance error where the agency failed to obtain prior written approval from the licensing department before opening a satellite office. This aligns with the low severity criteria for 'Administrative or paperwork issues' and 'Policy compliance errors (non-safety)' as it involves a reporting and approval failure with no associated safety, violence, restraint, medical, rights denial, or supervision concerns.
